elements.content: On the next page, an event with an uncertain outcome will be presented. An example is shown below:
Event: You receive a call from your boss that they want to meet with you tomorrow.

In the text fields, list as many different explanations as possible to explain why the event presented might have occurred. A 60 second timer will start when you proceed to the next page. Your responses may consist of a few words; you don’t need to write full sentences.
To add an additional text field, press the 'Submit' button on your screen or the Return key on your keyboard.
Try and think of as many explanations as you can in 60 seconds!

options: Event: Immediately after you do a presentation, the audience is quiet.
Event: You notice your heart beating more rapidly than usual.
Event: You hear a noise in your kitchen but didn’t think anyone else was home.
Event: You haven’t heard from a friend for 2 weeks and you usually talk weekly.
Event: You applied for a job 1 month ago and haven’t yet been contacted for an interview.

elements.content: You have 60 seconds to complete as many explanations as possible.
